speaker: Market Ruins
lines: Stalls wear moss aprons; awnings drape like old flags.
A jar of spice puffs when you lift the lid and forgets to stop.
A scale with one pan gone still balances fairly.
Footprints cross and uncross—pilgrims of a market that refuses to end.
A coin purse sags from a nail, tired of hope.
A vendor’s bell sleeps under a cloth; if you ring it, the city might wake.
A bronze token stamped with the gate's ribs glints in dust.
You find a note scratched on the counter: 'Pay the gate what it paid you.'
The ink is fresh. The hand is older than ink.

give_item.name: Gate Token
give_item.description: Bronze ribs, warm to the touch

choices.text: Return to the Sun Plaza gate.
Follow a side street toward a mirror-lit hall.
Pocket the vendor's bell and leave.
